autoPayment.desc: When your GME Pay balance is insufficient for a card payment, the shortfall will be automatically debited from your linked auto-debit account.
autoPayment.title: Auto Payment

items: If a GME card payment is cancelled, the refund will be returned to your GME Wallet. Refunds to other accounts are not available.
GME Card is a prepaid debit card. Installment payments are not available.
You can still use the GME app even if your card is cancelled. However, if you cancel your subscription in the GME app, your card will be automatically cancelled.
You are fully responsible for the loss of your phone or card. GME shall not be liable in such cases.
International affiliates follow the policies and standards of MasterCard.
cautions.title: Cautions

items: For overseas merchant payments, non-USD currencies are converted to USD based on Mastercard exchange rates, processed on the payment approval date (approved transactions) or the date GME receives billing information (unapproved transactions). The KRW billing amount, including a 1.25% overseas fee, is added to the KRW amount based on GME's USD exchange rate and deducted from GME Pay.
Billing Amount = (Payment Amount × Exchange Rate) + Overseas Fees (International Brand Fee² + Overseas Payment Fee³)
The exchange rate is GME's card payment USD rate, updated every 15 minutes, applied at the time of payment approval (or when GME receives billing information).
International Brand Fee² = (Payment Amount × Exchange Rate) × Mastercard Fee Rate (1.0%)
Overseas Payment Fee³ = (Payment Amount × Exchange Rate) × GME Card Fee Rate (0.25%)
When paying in KRW at overseas merchants, an additional DCC fee (approx. 3-15%) may apply. Blocking overseas KRW payments and paying in local currency is more cost-effective.
You can set overseas KRW payment (DCC) restrictions in the GME app. Go to: Card > Card Management > 'Overseas KRW Payment Restriction' setting (Default: 'Restricted')
For more details, please contact Customer Center (1588-6864) or visit www.gmeremit.com.
foreignPayment.title: International Payments & Other Information

visa_types.label: Eligible Visa Types
visa_types.value: E9, E7, F2, F5, F6, D8 & any visa with Legal Work Contract

items.a: Holders of D-2, E-9, E-10, E-7, E-1, E-2, E-3, F-2, F-2R, F-5, F-6, F-4, and G-1 visas are eligible. Available products may vary depending on your visa type.
items.q: Which visa holders can apply for a loan?

items.a: Only three documents are needed: Alien Registration Card (ARC), Employment Contract, and Passport. No complicated paperwork—just a smooth and simple process.
You can apply easily through the GME Finance mobile app. With just your smartphone, you can apply for a loan quickly and securely—anytime, anywhere.
items.q: How do I apply for a loan?

items.a: GME Finance provides secure handling of personal information through a system specifically designed for foreign customers. You can use our services with confidence.

hero.description: Apply for a loan easily with the GME app. We support your life in Korea with fast approvals and flexible terms.

step1.desc: Download GME App in Google Play Store or App Store. Register and Apply Loan.
step1.title: Apply Through GME App

step2.desc: Fill up your information and submit the required documents.
step2.title: Requirement Submission

step3.desc: Our staff will verify your documents and check your credit standing.
step3.title: Verification

step4.desc: Once approved, digital contract signing will proceed.
step4.title: Approval

step5.desc: After contract signing, loan amount will be deposited to your bank account.
step5.title: Disbursements
